model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The Player class contains all the attributes required by each players. It also contains methods that allow the player to interact with the different functionalities in the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              double money)
        Initializes a Player object.
        Parameters:
        name - A string representaiton of the PLayer object to used for display.
        money - The starting money given to the player that changes based on the number of players in game.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move(int diceroll)
        Moves the players diceroll amount of times. If the players goes over the 31-limit, the value is reseted to 0 and the rest is added to complete the move.
        Parameters:
        diceroll - An integer representation of how many steps the player will take.

      • isBankrupt

        public boolean isBankrupt()
        Checks if the player is bankrupt.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean value where TRUE shows that the player's money is less than or equal to 0, FALSE if otherwise.

      • rolldice

        public int rolldice()
        Rolls the dice.
        Returns:
        An integer of the resulting roll.

      • earn

        public void earn(double amount)
        Add's amount to the player's money.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double value that will be added to the Player's money

      • expense

        public void expense(double amount)
        Charges the player with an amount of money.
        Parameters:
        amount - A double value that will be subtracted to the Player's money
